course.title: Art and Violence in the Cultural Revolution
course.description: Examines the cultural implications of the Cultural Revolution (1966-1976). We will examine how art was violent towards people and how violence was turned into an art. We will also consider the link between violence, trauma, memory and writing. Materials include memoir, fiction, essay, "revolutionary Peking Opera," and film.
course.prerequisites: Four years of Mandarin or equivalent (with permission of instructor).
course.notes: Lectures and most readings in Chinese. Discussions in Chinese. Count toward Language Citation in Modern Chinese.
